meanings.definition: A type of bread made from a fermented dough.
meanings.sent1: I baked a delicious sourdough loaf for breakfast.
meanings.sent2: The bakery down the street is famous for its sourdough bread.
meanings.sent3: Why did the sandwich go to the bakery? To get a fresh sourdough friend!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the aroma of freshly baked sourdough, warm and comforting.
meanings.sent5: The tangy taste of sourdough always reminds me of home.

meanings.definition: A person who is experienced or seasoned in a particular field.
meanings.sent1: Grandpa is a sourdough when it comes to fishing; he knows all the best spots.
meanings.sent2: The sourdough of the team, Sarah, guided the newcomers with her expertise.
meanings.sent3: Why did the wise sourdough bring a ladder to work? To reach new heights of knowledge!
meanings.sent4: His wisdom was like that of a sourdough, slowly developed over time and full of flavor.
meanings.sent5: She was a sourdough in the art of storytelling, captivating audiences with every word.
